This is White's first mistake. I think he wanted to try and attack my Queen but forgot about the pawn on h that was protecting that square.
moves.19. Qe5 Bd6: I didn't realize my rook was in danger and forgot to protect it.
moves.20. Qxh8+ Bf8 21. f4 Qe7 22. Qe5 Bg7: Trying to get the Queen out of my territory
moves.26. Kf2 Qxg5: Taking the unprotected knight and protecting my own
moves.28. Kg1 O-O-O 29. Rf1: White sees my possible checkmate (Nf4 followed by Qg2#) and tries to stop it, but not without sacrificing the rook
moves.31. Nxd7 Rxd7: The next few moves involve White checking me in various places with the Queen and me interposing with my rook.
moves.32. Qg8+ Rd8 33. Qxe6+ Rd7 34. Qe8+ Rd8: Interesting move by White; I suspect he wanted to take my pawn on c4, but he forgot to concentrate on defense. From this point on, a checkmate is inevitable.
moves.35... Qxd4+: Taking the unprotected pawn and putting the king in check
moves.38... Rd1+: Moving my rook to check the king
moves.39. Qe1: White's only possible move at this point
moves.40. Kg1: White can't do anything else here.
